website_summaries.verdict: A great guide for taking out in the field. Covers a wide range of mushrooms.
pros: Number of mushroom species covered beats similar guides at over 1,000
Detailed information includes safety for eating and lookalikes
Convenient size and thickness for taking with you when you go mushroom hunting
cons: Mostly pencil illustrations, which are less useful than color photos

customer_reviews.title: GET A CURRENT EDITION!
customer_reviews.text: Lots and lots of unlabeled arrows on the illustrated plates. Says copyright 1987. Doesn’t list an edition that I can find. Haven’t been able to identify most of the fungi growing in my yard or the surrounding woods from this book. Eagerly bought the book because it came highly recommended from some local survivalist types. DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: DayBreaker

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have not found this not user friendly. Doesn’t include many common names instead has scientific designations. Some photos were pencil sketches which I found hard to recognize the mushroom types. I had a hard time finding some common mushrooms because I knew them eg. as Hens of the Woods. I coudlt recommend it. There are better choices especially ones that are specific to an area. Fir NE biginners who are interested in foraging, I highly recommend Edible and Medicinal Mushrooms of NE and Eastern Canada.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Too old to be useful for ID
customer_reviews.text: This book was published in 1987. Many of the species names have been changed or split into multiple species. Also the binding broke immediately. And it’s not really a photographic guide which is really what you need to properly ID. Images are in the center of the book and do not cover all species in the book. I’m sure it was a good book in the 80s but save your money and get something published recently.
customer_reviews.author: annpolan

customer_reviews.title: Very informative with description but not user friendly at all.  I suggest looking at other books about mushrooms.
customer_reviews.text: This book is not what I was really looking for. The listing of each mushroom is in one place the pictures are in another. Flip flip flip back and forth, not user friendly at all. Good detailed information but very poor organization.
customer_reviews.author: JJP

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource, Bit tedious for quick reference
customer_reviews.text: if you want to learn a TON about mushrooms, then this is q great resource. If you find something that you want to coarsely identify, then this is a bit hard to use. The pictures are all sketches and at the center of the book. To get the text you have to go throughout the book. The formatting of thr descriptions is hard to parse visually. But I learned a lot reading the book and skimming common mushrooms. In the end I use a book with photos to ID the mushrooms and then follow up with this book for more details.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Mushroom Book
customer_reviews.text: It's got a lot of info but not too many colored pictures, most are done in pencil sketches and so hard to know if you are getting the right one, might be better if the color photos were with the descriptions instead the pictures all in the middle of the book.
customer_reviews.author: MaryD

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Book for Mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional mushroom field guide; however I'm rating it only 3.5 stars of of 5, because it would be nice to have more pictures. It's amazing; however more challenging to use than other field guilds with more pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Unlisted

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but incomplete.
customer_reviews.text: Good mushroom book, but incomplete. I have seriously gotten into mushroom identification, and this book just doesn't have what I am looking at in southern Ohio n
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: Lots of information condensed into this guide. It's loaded with line drawings and precise descriptions that are so essential to identifying mushrooms, including edibility and poisonous lookalikes.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Well Written
customer_reviews.text: I know slim to nothing about local fungi, but this book is helping me out plenty. Using the sharp drawings, ruler on back fold, and articulate descriptions, I have been able to identify all the mushrooms that are growing around my forest in the North East US. If you're well versed in fungi, buy a thicker book. If you're novice, this book is an excellent starter. I'd prefer color pictures over drawings, but I have managed fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: Don't rely on drawings
customer_reviews.text: not much else to be said. The book Is a common reference book, but falls terribly short with drawings instead of pictures. I recommend national Audubon field guide first and foremost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mushrooming doesn't have to be dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I expected more photos and illustrations but the book is very helpful, a great addition, adds confidence to my pursuit.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good basic field guide for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good basic field guide for beginners. Don't use this as "Mushroom Gospel" but the drawings are made to highlight key areas to look for when out there mushroom hunting. When in doubt, don't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Similar to all the books in this line. Good starter. Shrooms can be dangerous so have more than one identifier.
customer_reviews.author: Rooty

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide to Mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this Book. It has a clear reference of the different Mushrooms. It comes with beautiful pictures. They really help you distinguish between the different mushrooms. What are safe to eat and what aren't. when i first received the book there were defective pages, but after getting on line with Amazon and disclosing my grief they quickly resolved my issue and replaced my book.I have full confidence in buying my products from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Glynis M Law

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love this book it is very informative and has great illustrations
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Stiles

customer_reviews.title: a must for the backpacker
customer_reviews.text: this is a great beginner book and something you can use. Start by gathering what you THINK is safe and take it home or to an expert to see if you got it right. This way no one is in danger and you learn too.
customer_reviews.author: marineguyNY

customer_reviews.title: Yay
customer_reviews.text: I’ll always swear by Peterson guides one more to my collection!
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This book is pretty good, however it could have better pictures.
customer_reviews.author: michael g brown

customer_reviews.title: Usually my start to finish source
customer_reviews.text: I start with a petersons field guide and don't usually require any additional reference books, but keep in mind a field guide is a field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. The package was ripped open in 3 places. This has never happened before.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Hale

customer_reviews.title: Very Detailed
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed book and a great size to take along on mushroom hunts. I was a little disappointed with the pictures - kind of small and scattered throughout the book but - the information it provides is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: lotsofcrome

customer_reviews.title: Fungi at it's best!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of information in this book, but still hard work to identify "for sure" what you find in the wild. Book that will be well used in my walks.
customer_reviews.author: Judi S. Claveloux-roth

customer_reviews.title: Peterson publications are the best
customer_reviews.text: as always Peterson Publishing Pocket guides are the best references. They are thorough and well illustrated. And they will fit into a jacket or back pack pocket for quick access
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: It's small enough for me to take it with me ...
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough for me to take it with me when my husband & I walk the woods. They are close to the house. We often find mushroom & I got the book to use to see which are OK to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Craft

customer_reviews.title: Very detailed
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are rookies when it comes to mushroom hunting so we wanted a book with detailed pictures and information that is easy to understand. This book was great.
customer_reviews.author: J&A

customer_reviews.title: Gaining mushroom knowledge
customer_reviews.text: This Field Guide to Mushrooms is somewhat easy to understand, but requires the user to have basic knowledge of some characteristics of mushrooms. There could be mistakes in ID made. As with any mushroom guide, the user must pay strict attention, and be very careful. The print is very easy to read, and the pictures are extensive. I feel this would be a good book for the hunter who has some basic experience in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Janice G. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Love all Peterson Guide's, makes a nice addition to my packable, waterproof Survival Library!
customer_reviews.text: Love all Peterson Guide's, makes a nice addition to my packable, waterproof Survival Library!
customer_reviews.author: co

customer_reviews.title: Good field guide
customer_reviews.text: A handy reference. I especially appreciate the similar species sections and emphasis arrows in the illustrations, which help with identifying wild specimens.
customer_reviews.author: R. Soulam

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide to Mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend, he's studying mycology and this book just exploded his brain a bit with excitement. Greatly appreciated! -Kanna
customer_reviews.author: Kanna Blade

customer_reviews.title: great books. fast
customer_reviews.text: Peterson guides, what can you say? great books. fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: pam wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Good resource guide wish it had photgraphs
customer_reviews.text: I was actually hoping it would have full color photographs in it but it will work until I can find something better
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Book review
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and intense reading. This book has a lot of great information. The pictures are a major plus. I really enjoy reading and learning from it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the visuals to identify mushrooms safely.
customer_reviews.text: Sucks... no actual photos of the mushrooms and the only identification visuals are somewhat limited drawings that are displaced from the discussions. I had hoped to use this book to begin to identify edible mushrooms. Instead I got a wordy, no visual book on mushrooms. If you like read 10,000 page Alistair Cooke novels you might want to read this - but I doubt it. Don't buy to help you identify mushrooms - at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I still am unable to distinguish certain mushrooms. Have ...
customer_reviews.text: I still am unable to distinguish certain mushrooms. Have decided to not take a chance and just not pick them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mushrooms fieldguide
customer_reviews.text: i used this book so far only in the fall. it was really good and helped me identify several different types. most were poisonous. this can be expected in the area and season i searched. i look forward to searching more in the spring. a great fieldguide with color illustrations.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: acceptable
customer_reviews.text: for me it is difficult to use. however it is still worth the price for what it contains. G. L.
customer_reviews.author: GARY  WILLAMS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a great present for my niece who is getting into the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Mushrooms of North America
customer_reviews.text: This item shipped fast and secure, no problems, brand new, the book itself is really good for identity of mushrooms, i found a couple of mushrooms at the park and used the color plates in the book and matched them up in a few minutes. Its not quite as thorough as the edible plants book, but i am still pleased.
customer_reviews.author: G. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would like more color illustrations but i would say it's very informative and worth every penny for sure
customer_reviews.author: Josh D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: came in great shape and it was what i wanted
customer_reviews.author: cgh. lampp

customer_reviews.title: Could save your life
customer_reviews.text: Mushrooms are tricky little plants and yo.u really need this book to be sure that you do not die from ingesting the wrong plants. A must have for mushroom seekers and also anyone who needs to find edible wild things that are safe.
customer_reviews.author: cecily s quimby

customer_reviews.title: EZ to keep with you,GOOD to have.
customer_reviews.text: well illustrated , nice photos . I like the way the poison warnings look !!.EZ to under stand. nice size, fits in my hand well.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa S.

customer_reviews.title: This should not be your only Field Guide for North America, but Ok as a supplement to other sources.
customer_reviews.text: This should not be your only Field Guide for North America, but Ok as a supplement to other sources. Some info is conflicting from other field guides.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Ruiter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish the book was more organized on a beginners standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Several pages fell out the first time that I browsed through the book (poor binding). Also, the pictures are not very realistic because they are drawn. This does not give confidence in identification. I tried to save a few dollars but I wish I would have just went with the Audubon edition.

customer_reviews.title: A Field Guide to Mushrooms: North America (Peterson Field Guides)
customer_reviews.text: Love mushroom hunting? this book is pretty good. My husband just needed a refresher so we purchased it and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Field Guide!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! - I'm very pleased with my purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a gift because the Peterson Field Guides are always good. We have others. To our delight we know the author and had him for a professor years ago! Delighted.
customer_reviews.author: mak

customer_reviews.title: Best Go To reference for edible mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: This is the best go to reference book for collecting edible mushrooms. The color drawing can impart much more info than photos. Clearly describes what to look for and what to look out for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I have all of the Peterson field guides and I think this one is very vague. I will not be using it to ID edible mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Good book.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this book. We already have the edible plants one. Great addition to it.
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: Clean and un-used
customer_reviews.text: This book has nice illustrations, no photos, but the drawings are clear and well colored. Should be a companion book in forays, not the only reference source.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Keurajian

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good field guide on mushroom for the beginner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seller did fine, but it doesn't have the best pictures
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Jorgenson

customer_reviews.title: Mushrooms... More than you could ever want to know about them!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very technical. It should be required reading for college students interested in this field. It did not suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicrisguy

customer_reviews.title: 2nd best mushroom book
customer_reviews.text: The pictures in this guide are not quite as nice as in the audubon version but is still easy to use and a nice handy size for carrying in a pocket
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Main

customer_reviews.title: Fun camping game!
customer_reviews.text: Take a bite of a mushroom and try to find it in the book before you loose consciousne...
customer_reviews.author: Desert ape

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are horrible, very difficult to identify species. Not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: dme

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted mushrooms of Montana with colored pictures next to the description so I will keep looking until I find thr right book.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Bell

customer_reviews.title: ARE YOU A PHD?
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this REFERENCE book for PHD's. I wanted a "FIELD" guide - not a detailed reference book to info about fungi that I cannot and do not want to know or understand. I just wanted a picture & short description book to identify edible vs inedible mushrooms. DO NOT Buy this book looking for a simple field guide, but a detailed PHD analysis of fungi. I did not return it because the costs of shipping exceeds the cost of the book. Maybe I will find someone who has the time and intellect to like this book.
customer_reviews.author: MoleMan

customer_reviews.title: Field guide to North American mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: A useful guide to many species of North American mushrooms
customer_reviews.author: Impulsive

product_meta.title: A Field Guide to Mushrooms: North America (Peterson Field Guides)
